title: How to Set Up a Wireless Presentation

steps.title: Get a wireless remote presenter.
steps.content: Get a wireless remote presenter. This device, commonly called a clicker, resembles a simple mouse and has at least two buttons, forward and back, that move forward or backward in the presentation. Many clickers also have laser pointers that you can use to point out certain aspects of each slide, as well as other embellishments, and most are small enough to comfortably hold in one hand. Choose a clicker you like. Using this clicker allows you to remove away from the computer, walk around the stage, and engage more closely with the audience, without giving up control of the computer.

steps.title: Connect the clicker to your computer.
steps.content: Connect the clicker to your computer. Wireless presenters always come with a receiver, usually placed in a slot at the back of the clicker, or sometimes hidden behind the battery cover. Take off this receiver and connect it to an available USB port in your computer. Put in any necessary batteries or other requirements for your clicker. Once the receiver connects to your computer, it will automatically install the necessary driver. Wait until this process finishes before proceeding.

steps.title: Make sure the clicker works properly.
steps.content: Make sure the clicker works properly. It's always a good idea to test your technology well before your presentation so that you can solve any problems that arise without delaying or interrupting the presentation. To check that your clicker works, open any PowerPoint presentation and put it in presentation mode. Click all buttons on the clicker, especially the forward and back buttons, to make sure they work. Check the user manual for the maximum distance covered by the wireless presenter. When giving the presentation, make sure you do not move beyond that distance.

steps.title: Know when to use a Wireless Presentation Gateway, or WPG.
steps.content: Know when to use a Wireless Presentation Gateway, or WPG. Since most wireless presenters can only move forward and back, they are not suitable for a presentation where the presenter needs to be close to the computer, for example to toggle between files such as the presentation file, a spreadsheet, and a video. In this case, you need a wireless device that will replace the video cable between the computer and projector. This device is called a Wireless Presentation Gateway, or WPG, and it connects to a computer through WiFi. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Set up the WPG on your computer.
steps.content: Set up the WPG on your computer. You can do this through Wi-Fi Direct or any available Wi-Fi network.

steps.title: Connect the WPG to a power outlet.
steps.content: Connect the WPG to a power outlet. Then connect it to a projector using a video cable (VGA or HDMI).

steps.title: Turn the WPG and projector on.
steps.content: Turn the WPG and projector on. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Install the driver and software for the WPG.
steps.content: Install the driver and software for the WPG. Find all the necessary software on the installation cd supplied in the WPG box. Follow the installation instructions included here.

steps.title: Activate WiFi.
steps.content: Activate WiFi. Find the WPG on the list of available wireless network connections on your computer. Select this network and connect your computer to it.

steps.title: Run the WPG software you have installed.
steps.content: Run the WPG software you have installed. Let it finish the connection process so that your computer will be fully connected to the WPG.

steps.title: Test the connection.
steps.content: Test the connection. On your computer, start any PowerPoint presentation and put it on presentation mode. With some delays, you should be able to see it show up on the projector. Make sure you can switch between slides and screens on your computer. Open all files you'll need for your presentation, and make sure you can quickly switch back and forth between them.

steps.title: Connect WPG to power outlet.
steps.content: Connect WPG to power outlet. Then connect it to the network using LAN cable and to a projector using video cable (VGA or HDMI).

steps.title: Make sure that your WPG is recognized by the network.
steps.content: Make sure that your WPG is recognized by the network. Consult the network admin for this, if necessary.

steps.title: Turn the WPG and Projector on.
steps.content: Turn the WPG and Projector on. At this stage the WPG should display an address (in the form of xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx) through the projector.

steps.title: Connect your computer to the wireless network.
steps.content: Connect your computer to the wireless network. Turn on Wi-Fi on your computer and choose the available network. Connect to that network, not to the WPG.

steps.title: Connect your computer to the WPG.
steps.content: Connect your computer to the WPG. To do this, open a web browser on your computer, and type the address from above into the address bar. Press Enter to make the connection. Once connected, it may start installing the necessary driver and software. If this does not happen, install them using the installation cd supplied in the WPG box. Follow all installation instructions.

steps.title: Once the installation process is finished, run the WPG software you have installed.
steps.content: Once the installation process is finished, run the WPG software you have installed. Let it finish up the connection process with the WPG.

steps.title: Make sure the connection is working.
steps.content: Make sure the connection is working. On your computer, start any PowerPoint presentation and put it on presentation mode. With some delays, you should be able to see it through the projector. Try switching back and forth between slides and screens to make sure everything works properly.
